fullText: “American Psycho,” a musical about a fashion-conscious serial killer, is not the most misbegotten show ever on Broadway. It only feels that way for a couple of moments – such as the production number that features zombie-like movements by half-naked cast members smeared in blood. Overall, the musical has a stylish visual design and stylized violence; a catchy 80s techno-pop score presented like a series of live 80s MTV music videos; and a cast with impressive physiques, starting with Benjamin Walker, dressed only in underpants for much of the show’s nearly three hours. Full review at DC Theatre Scene Holiday Inn Review, Video, PicsOctober 6, 2016In "Broadway" Daddy Long Legs: Review, Photographs, VideoSeptember 28, 2015In "DC Theatre Scene" Hadestown on Broadway: Review, pics, videoApril 17, 2019In "Broadway"
dtliExcerpt: The musical version of American Psycho is slick and stylish, with a strong performance by Benjamin Walker as Patrick Bateman, but it feels emotionally hollow.
